sentences: Võiks öelda, et see on hea idee.
Tema peaks olema kohal, võiks olla juba siin.
context: The Estonian word 'võiks' is the conditional form of the verb 'võima' (to be able to/can) and functions as a modal auxiliary verb. It expresses possibility, suggestion, or politeness in conditional or hypothetical situations. It can translate to English equivalents like 'could', 'might', 'should', or 'ought to'. The word is commonly used when making polite requests, suggestions, or expressing what might happen under certain conditions.
